poem:
Divisive Shadows

Yoon, narrow victor,  
prosecutor's gavel thundered,  
promising voids—  
young men in rank  
as old fears unearthed:  
elusive peace.  
His reign,  
a fleeting echo;  
martial whispers  
etched his fall  
in concrete streets,  
silent as dawn.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How South Korea’s president sealed his own downfall For Yoon Suk Yeol, last week’s short-lived martial law declaration wasn’t just a catastrophic miscalculation – it was the culmination of a presidency that had been troubled from the start. When he narrowly won the election in March 2022, Yoon was already a divisive figure. The former prosecutor turned politician positioned himself as an arch-conservative, winning support particularly from young male voters by promising to abolish the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
